[{"id":"_r_KqHCwF_","type":"header","data":{"text":"Slack Integration","col":12}},{"id":"_bKx0JqYHY","type":"paragraph","data":{"text":"Manage your Slack integrations and webhooks for ERPNext notifications.","col":12}},{"id":"_1ELZhd5Pm","type":"header","data":{"text":"Quick Links","col":12}},{"id":"_quick_links","type":"quick_list","data":{"quick_list_filter":null,"col":12}},{"id":"_rDg4NWhRn","type":"header","data":{"text":"Settings & Configuration","col":12}},{"id":"_settings_links","type":"quick_list","data":{"quick_list_filter":null,"col":12}},{"id":"_notifications","type":"header","data":{"text":"Notifications","col":12}},{"id":"_notification_links","type":"quick_list","data":{"quick_list_filter":null,"col":12}},{"id":"_setup_guide","type":"header","data":{"text":"Setup Guide","col":12}},{"id":"_guide_text","type":"paragraph","data":{"text":"
  1. Create a Slack App in your Slack workspace
  2. Enable Incoming Webhooks in your Slack App
  3. Copy the Webhook URL from Slack
  4. Create a new Slack Webhook URL in ERPNext with the copied URL
  5. Create or edit a Notification and select 'Slack' as the channel
  6. Select your configured Slack Webhook URL
","col":12}}]
label: Slack Integration
name: Slack Integration
title: Slack Integration
